Another opinion

The US has sacrified much in its largely one-sided support for Israel - mainly in its standing in the Middle East in how it is viewed in Arab society. The animosity felt against the US with its support of Israel fuels a large part of the Arab anger that leads to terrorism. It is only fair, then, to ask - what does the US gain from this alliance? Is there anything that Israel has done for us? This is an important question. I can predict a flood of responses saying that Israeli supporters in the US fund political campaigns and that any politician that doesn't show full support for Israel gets attacked by the Anti-Defamation league and organized against politically. All that is understood. However, is that really all there is? I have also heard comments that a Democratically stable Israel in the Middle East helps stabilize the region. This argument also never quite made sense. How, SPECIFICALLY, does that happen? The only reason I can think of is that corrupt leaders in many Middle Eastern countries can divert Arab anger from their own internal problems to the Arab-Israeli conflict. Either way, my main question is: What important and positive benefit does the US gain from its alliance with Israel?

post_info.post_title: What does the US gain from alliance with Israel?

Iuris
Well, having a firm ally right in striking range of the oil fields seems like a good idea. Especially since it's the exception in having a far more western style of culture than the other neighbours.
Another opinion

Well, having a firm ally right in striking range of the oil fields seems like a good idea. Especially since it's the exception in having a far more western style of culture than the other neighbours.

 I can see how, in a worst case scenario, that could be a possibility - i.e. either using Israeli bases to launch US combat flights or having the Israelis as allies in a fight against a particular Middle Eastern country. However, using such an option in a non-worst-case situation could create more problems than it solves since it links the US even more with the hated Israel and could turn a simmering hatred of the US into war-like antagonism by bistanding Middle Eastern countries. Indeed, our somewhat one-sided alliance with Israel might make it more likely for a worst-case scenario to crop up than if we were not allied. 
 
 All that being said, I do believe that Israel has the right to exist and would support helping out Israel militarily if that survival was actually threatened. However, I find it quite frustrating that we continue to give aid to Israel seemingly unconditionally. I think our aid should be contingent on them making real strides in the Middle East peace process and, at the minimum, stop new settlements being built in the West Bank and start to dismantle the old ones.
Marat
